hadiths.english_translation: Biographical entry: He heard from Ikrimah and from Tawus. Ibn Jurayj, Yazid ibn Abi Hakim, and Mu'tammir heard from him. Ali said, from Ibn Uyaynah: I asked Yusuf ibn Ya'qub: 'How was al-Hakam ibn Aban?' He said: 'That is our master, he died in the year 154 AH at the age of eighty-four. Ikrimah came to Yemen in the year 100 AH.' Ali said: Mu'ammar died in 154, and al-Hakam died after him by one year.

chainIssues: Contains contradictory information about death year (154 vs 155)
Includes scholarly analysis rather than complete hadith chain

potential_issues.issue: Contradictory death year information (154 vs 155 AH)
potential_issues.impact: Biographical data inconsistency indicates possible manuscript variation or confusion

potential_issues.issue: Entry is primarily biographical assessment, not hadith transmission
potential_issues.impact: Contains scholarly criticism rather than complete isnad

potential_issues.issue: Second narrator is Ikrimah from Makkah but al-Hakam ibn Aban was in Yemen
potential_issues.impact: Raises questions about the possibility of direct transmission

potential_issues.issue: Alternative account mentions 'Mu'tammar died in 154' - possibly confusing different individuals

Topics: Biographical information about al-Hakam ibn Aban

hadiths.english_translation: Ismail ibn Aban said: Muhammad ibn Talhah told us, from al-Hakam Abu Amr, from Dirar ibn Amr, from Abu Abdullah as-Shami, from Tamim ad-Dari from the Prophet ﷺ, saying: 'Friday prayer is obligatory except for a woman, or a child, or a sick person, or a traveler, or a slave.' And it was not supported (by other chains).

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Muttalib ibn Hashim

chainIssues: Ismail ibn Aban is Saduq Yugrib - produces strange hadiths
Muhammad ibn Talhah is Saduq (mid-level reliability)
Dirar ibn Amr is Da'if (weak narrator) - THIS BREAKS CHAIN RELIABILITY
Abu Abdullah as-Shami is majhul al-hal (unknown condition)
Multiple Saduq narrators in the chain
Chain includes weak narrator (Dirar) making it unreliable
Note states 'it was not supported' - no corroborating chains

potential_issues.issue: Dirar ibn Amr is classified as Da'if (weak)
potential_issues.impact: Presence of weak narrator severely compromises chain reliability

potential_issues.issue: Multiple Saduq narrators (Muhammad ibn Talhah, al-Hakam) require corroboration
potential_issues.impact: Chain relies on mid-level reliability narrators

potential_issues.issue: Ismail ibn Aban is Saduq Yugrib (produces unusual hadiths)
potential_issues.impact: Beginning of chain has tendency toward strange traditions

potential_issues.issue: Abu Abdullah as-Shami is majhul al-hal (unknown condition)
Explicit note 'ولم يتابع عليه' - it was not supported/corroborated
potential_issues.impact: No supporting chains for this hadith weakens it significantly

potential_issues.issue: Hadith claims Friday prayer obligation excludes enslaved persons
potential_issues.impact: Jurisprudential claim requires strong evidence, which is lacking

hadiths.english_translation: Biographical note: He heard from al-A'raj. Ibn Abi Dhi'b narrated from him. Abdullah said: al-Layth told me, saying: Khalid ibn Yazid told me, from Ibn Abi Hilal, from Ja'far ibn Abdullah, from al-Hakam ibn Muslim ibn al-Hakam, that Ibn Hermez told him from Abu Hurayrah, that the Prophet ﷺ 'used to kiss while fasting.'

narrators.name: Ibn Abi Hilal
narrators.alternative_names: Ibn Abi Hilal, Abdullah ibn Abi Hilal

narrators.name: al-Hakam ibn Muslim

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ

Ibn Hermez is majhul al-hal (unknown condition)
Khalid ibn Yazid is Saduq (requires corroboration)

Chain integrity severely compromised by weak narrators

hadiths.english_translation: Biographical entry: He heard Sufyan ibn Uyaynah saying: I reached our teachers from seventy years ago, among them Amr ibn Dinar, saying: The Qur'an is the speech of Allah and is not created. Abu Abdullah said: We met him in the year 211 or 212 AH, or thereabouts.

chainIssues: Biographical and doctrinal entry rather than hadith
Mentions historical encounter and doctrinal position
No complete transmission chain to a specific hadith

potential_issues.issue: Entry is biographical and doctrinal rather than a hadith transmission
potential_issues.impact: Not a hadith in traditional sense but rather a biographical note with theological statement

potential_issues.issue: No specific hadith text, only doctrinal statement about Qur'an
potential_issues.impact: This is a statement of doctrine rather than a reported saying or action

potential_issues.issue: Date information (211-212 AH) may be editorial addition
potential_issues.impact: Suggests editorial commentary rather than primary source

potential_issues.issue: Statement about Qur'an not being created relates to theological debates
potential_issues.impact: Reflects creedal positions of later periods

Topics: Qur'an as the speech of Allah
